intro: Antholyza quinquenervia, commonly known as the five-veined antholyza, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with five distinct veins. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, smooth-seeded fruits. Antholyza quinquenervia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
